title: Hi, I’m Riot Conquisitor, Community Manager at Riot OCE. Ask me anything!

embed.description: The latest Tweets from Riot Conquisitor (@RiotConquisitor). Senior Recruiter at Riot Games (please note this is my personal twitter and not a Riot Games account). Sydney

body:
Hello summoners!

I'm Ivan Davies (Riot Conquisitor) and I work in recruitment and community at Riot OCE, I'm going to be hanging around for the next few hours answering anything you’d like to know about me and what I do :)

A little bit about myself, I moved from London in 2013 to join Riot OCE. I started work as the OCE Recruiter, where I spent most of my day sourcing for potential Rioters. In July this year, I transitioned in to the Community Manager position. 

I come from a Sports Psychology / Teacher background and have some experience of working with elite sports teams in the UK. I've tried to help our local esports teams (mainly The Chiefs and Legacy) to build routines and performance mindsets to help them succeed at the top level. 

I first started playing computer games from a young age when my Dad bought an Atari 800XL; my favourite game was Pole Position. I have been playing LoL since 2013, but am one of the more causal players in the office, so I'm still really bad at LoL. Anyway my favourite champion is currently Pantheon.

Outside of work, I have a young family (my daughter Evelyn is 10 months old), I'm a big Chelsea FC supporter and love all forms of Cricket. 

So that’s a little bit about me :) Feel free to ask me anything!

Hello Mr Conquisitor! Welcome to OCE. I hope you find your time in Australia a wonderful one.

My question is in regard to the toxicity on this server. I know Riot have said they're testing out Feedback, but after gaming on NA for years and just leveling up my OCE account to a ranked status (still in elo hell atm), I still find OCE an extremely toxic server. Is Riot aware at how toxic it is? Are there any other plans in the future to fix this? It's just getting to a point where I don't even enjoy gaming anymore. 

Thank you so much for your input!!

C0ntract

Hey man,

I can jump in and provide a little bit of context here. First of all a lot of us play lots of LoL (In fact I've played 583 solo queue ranked games this season). We feel the pain when there is this one player in the game being really negative and it sucks.

Let me talk aboue some of the things we are working on to help address this problem;

A while a go on all Riot servers globally we set up [Instant feedback systems](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/new-player-reform-system-heads-testing) in place which is an automated system delivering two week and permanent bans for verbal toxicity within 15 minutes. More recently we [powered up](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/instant-feedback-powers) this system. 

"Now, we’re bolting a few new cylinders onto the instant feedback engine. Fueled by your reports on what is and isn’t acceptable behaviour (and some elbow grease on our end), chat restrictions and intentional feeding bans are now delivered and enforced within 15 minutes of a game’s end. Beyond those upgrades, we’re moving reform cards into the client and rounding out the design value trinity by rewarding positive players with an exclusive summoner icon."

AND with this power up we added in automated intentional feeding bans.

"Through a ton of in-game metrics, chat logs, and even historical play patterns, we ensured the system understands the difference between intentional feeding and being crushed by a Riven main in solo queue. You shouldn’t need to worry about just having a bad game.
Like with all new feature launches, the whole player behaviour team will hand-review the first few thousand cases to make sure everything’s working right."

On top of this we also have a [Leaver Buster system](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) in place for players that dc/afk games.

We are also working on a new champion select process. The goal with this is to prevent a common point of stress and negativity around role selection. You can read more about it here - http://ask.fm/RiotLyte/answer/133205853890

If you want more information about the current systems check out our [Player Behaviour FAQ](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq-updated-for-instant-feedback)

If you're super interested in this problem and want to explore more into the vision and design values of our player behaviour team check out these dev blogs

Exploring Player Behaviour design values: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/exploring-player-behavior-design-values

Player Behaviour design values: Reform: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/player-behavior-design-values-reform

Player Behaviour design values: Reward: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/player-behavior-design-values-reward

Player Behaviour design values: Punishment http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/player-behavior-design-values-punishment

If after all this you want to learn even MORE let me know there are a bunch of GDC (Game Developer Conference) talks that our Player Behaviour lead Riot Lyte has done. 

You can also check out his Ask.fm here - http://ask.fm/RiotLyte

Hello! I'm attempting to chase the dream of working in the esports industry. For 2 years I have managed a small but steadily growing Facebook community of League of Legends players.  Other than hosting tournaments what can a community manager do to encourage others to share their experiences and spread the word of League of Legends to increase our ever growing community?

Hey Djbentz, 

Its great to hear that you're so passionate about eSports. From a Community stand point its always great when players share their experiences. How could we try to encourage this?
1. Raise Awareness of what's happening, which tournaments when and where. 
2. Make it easier for players to know how to find our more about up and coming tournaments.
3. Provide visibility of the tournament (perhaps using our events page or even Facebook)
4. Work closely with the tournament organizers, to help how we at Riot can help with the above. 

From a community leader stand point we need to find more ways to bring players together. Let me know how we can help you this or next year?

Thanks
Conquisitor
